guiEditor.typeIdTooltip: Unique identifier for the type. Example: nemaki:customDocument
guiEditor.baseTypeTooltip: CMIS base type. Select from Document, Folder, etc.
guiEditor.parentTypeTooltip: Type to inherit from. If empty, base type is used
guiEditor.creatableTooltip: Whether objects of this type can be created
guiEditor.queryableTooltip: Whether objects of this type can be searched by query
guiEditor.fulltextIndexedTooltip: Whether to include in fulltext search index
guiEditor.includedInSupertypeQueryTooltip: Whether to include in parent type query results
guiEditor.controllableACLTooltip: Whether access control lists can be applied

guiEditor.allowedSourceTypesTooltip: Select types allowed as source for this relationship
guiEditor.allowedTargetTypesTooltip: Select types allowed as target for this relationship
guiEditor.noPropertiesDescription: Click the "Add Property" button to add properties
guiEditor.jsonEditorDescription: You can edit the type definition directly in JSON format. Changes are synced with the GUI editor.

guiEditor.nonCmisWarningItem2: Property definition changes require attention to existing data consistency
guiEditor.nonCmisWarningItem3: Compatibility with other CMIS clients is not guaranteed

reindexStatus.title: Reindex Status
reindexStatus.silentDropCountTooltip: Number of documents silently dropped by Solr during batch processing. These are automatically re-indexed.
reindexStatus.reindexedCountTooltip: Number of documents successfully recovered through individual re-indexing after silent drop detection.
reindexStatus.verificationSkippedCountTooltip: Number of documents skipped from verification due to query length limits. These documents are not checked for silent drops.

reindexActions.title: Reindex Operations
reindexActions.fullReindexDesc: Reindex all documents in the repository.
reindexActions.fullReindexConfirmDesc: This operation may take a long time.
reindexActions.folderReindexDesc: Reindex documents under the specified folder.
reindexActions.clearIndexConfirmDesc: This operation cannot be undone. All indexes will be deleted.
reindexActions.optimizeIndexConfirmDesc: This operation affects the entire Solr core (not repository-specific). Search performance may degrade during execution.
